questions.article: Whether the reign of a French monarch such as Louis VII or Henry V was historically consequential or relatively uneventful, its trajectory was shaped by questions of legitimacy and therefore cannot be understood without a corollary understanding of the characteristics without which the monarch would have been forced to ______ the throne.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?
questions.solution:
翻译：
无论是路易七世还是亨利五世这样的法国君主的统治，在历史上是意义重大还是相对平淡，其统治轨迹都受到合法性问题的影响。因此，如果不相应地理解一些特质，就无法理解这些统治，而没有这些特质，君主将被迫____王位。
解析：
根据语境，这里说的是君主如果不具备某些特质，就会被迫放弃王位。
  • A 选项 “reciprocate” 意思是 “reciprocate” ，意思是 “回报；回应” ，不符合 “放弃王位” 的语境。
  • B 选项 “annotate” 意为 “注释；作注解” ，与放弃王位毫无关联，不符合语境。
  • C 选项 “abandon” 表示 “放弃；遗弃” ，“abandon the throne” 即 “放弃王位” ，符合语境。
  • D 选项 “equalize” 意思是 “使相等；使均衡” ，不符合此处语境。
综上，正确答案是 C。

questions.article: With his widely celebrated portraits of poet Seamus Heaney, molecular biologist Struther Arnott, and other prominent figures in different fields, British painter Peter Edwards has ______ substantial prestige as an artist.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?
questions.solution:
翻译：
英国画家彼得・爱德华兹凭借其广受赞誉的诗人谢默斯・希尼、分子生物学家斯特鲁瑟・阿诺特以及其他不同领域杰出人物的肖像画，____作为一名艺术家的极高声望。
解析：
这里需要一个表示 “获得” 意思的词，来体现画家因为那些画作而获得声望。
  • A 选项 “required” 意思是 “需要；要求” ，不符合语境。
  • B 选项 “remembered” 是 “记得；记住” 的意思，与获得声望无关，不符合语境。
  • C 选项 “achieved” 意为 “获得；取得” ，“achieve prestige” 表示 “获得声望” ，符合语境。
  • D 选项 “avoided” 是 “避免” 的意思，与文意相悖，不符合语境。
综上，正确答案是 C

questions.article: Though many ______ studies of the effect of altitude on blood chemistry focus on people who live above sea level, researchers Suleiman A. Al-Sweedan and Moath Alhaj recently chose the novel path of focusing on people who live below sea level, in locations such as the California towns of Salton City and Coachella.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

questions.article:
The following text is adapted from William Wordsworth's 1798 poem "Lines Written a Few Miles above Tintern Abbey."

Once again
Do I behold these steep and lofty cliffs,
Which on a wild secluded scene impress
Thoughts of more deep seclusion; and connect
The landscape with the quiet of the sky.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does the word "deep" most nearly mean?
questions.solution:
翻译：
以下文本改编自威廉・华兹华斯 1798 年的诗作《丁登寺旁杂咏》。
我再次
凝望这些陡峭高耸的悬崖，
它们在一片荒凉幽僻的景致上，
唤起更为深沉的隐逸之感；并将
这风景与天空的宁静相连。
4. 在文中，“deep” 一词最接近以下哪个意思？
解析：
在诗中 “deep seclusion” 描述的是一种程度很深的隐逸、幽僻之感。
  • A 选项 “Tough” 意思是 “艰难的；坚韧的” ，与 “deep” 在诗中的含义不相关。
  • B 选项 “Hideous” 意为 “可怕的；丑恶的” ，不符合诗中语境。
  • C 选项 “Complicated” 表示 “复杂的” ，和 “deep” 所表达的程度深的意思不同。
  • D 选项 “Intense” 有 “强烈的；极度的” 意思，“intense seclusion” 能体现出诗中那种深沉、浓郁的幽僻感，与 “deep” 意思相近。
综上，正确答案是 D

questions.article: The Caves of Gargas paintings—stencils of human hands found in what is now France and dating from around 27,000 years ago—are thought of as art today, but the question of whether the people of the time understood the paintings as something akin to art in our modern sense or in some other way entirely is ______; we will never be able to answer it.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?
questions.solution:
翻译：
加尔加斯洞穴壁画——在如今法国境内发现的、距今约 27000 年的人手模板画——在当今被视为艺术，但当时的人们是将这些画理解为类似我们现代意义上的艺术，还是完全从其他角度理解，这个问题是 ______；我们永远无法解答。
解析：
根据后文 “we will never be able to answer it（我们永远无法解答）” 可知，这里需要一个表示问题无法解决的词。
  • A 选项 “irresolvable” 意思是 “无法解决的；不能分解的”，符合 “我们永远无法解答” 所体现的问题无法解决的语境。
  • B 选项 “self-contradictory” 意为 “自相矛盾的”，文中未提及问题存在自相矛盾之处，不符合语境。
  • C 选项 “imperative” 表示 “必要的；紧急的”，与问题无法解决的意思不相关，不符合语境。
  • D 选项 “unavoidable” 意思是 “不可避免的”，并非强调问题无法解决，不符合语境。
综上，正确答案是 A。

questions.article: Eden Robinson is a novelist and a member of the Haisla Nation in western Canada. Critics and fellow writers have praised her work for combining traditional Haisla stories with popular genres of literature, such as fantasy and mystery fiction. But Robinson is not the only Indigenous writer to blend traditional stories with popular literature. In the 2019 novel Empire of Wild, Cherie Dimaline successfully blended the oral storytelling tradition of her people, the Metis, with horror fiction.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main purpose of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: To discuss two writers who blend traditional Indigenous stories with popular genres

options.name: B
options.content: To urge younger Indigenous authors to avoid writing in popular genres

options.name: C
options.content: To argue that traditional Indigenous stories are more memorable than most novels are

options.name: D
options.content: To explain why one Indigenous author has achieved more success than another has

questions.correct: To discuss two writers who blend traditional Indigenous stories with popular genres
questions.solution:
翻译：
伊登・罗宾逊是一名小说家，也是加拿大西部海斯拉民族的一员。评论家及同行作家称赞她的作品将海斯拉传统故事与奇幻、悬疑小说等流行文学体裁相结合。但罗宾逊并非唯一一位将传统故事与流行文学相融合的原住民作家。在 2019 年的小说《狂野帝国》中，切丽・迪马利纳成功地将她所在的梅蒂斯民族的口述故事传统与恐怖小说相结合。
解析：
文章先介绍了伊登・罗宾逊将传统故事与流行文学体裁结合的创作特点，接着通过 “but” 转折指出她不是唯一这样做的原住民作家，并以切丽・迪马利纳为例进一步说明。整体是在讨论这两位将传统原住民故事与流行体裁融合的作家。
  • A 选项：“讨论两位将传统原住民故事与流行体裁融合的作家” ，符合文章主旨。
  • B 选项：文中未提及敦促年轻原住民作家避免写流行体裁相关内容，不符合文章目的。
  • C 选项：文章没有对传统原住民故事和小说的可记忆性进行比较，不符合文章目的。
  • D 选项：文章未对两位作家谁更成功及原因进行阐述，不符合文章目的。
综上，正确答案是 A

questions.article:
Text 1

Attempts to automate classification of music into genres have not been very successful, and we may be at the limit of what is technologically possible.But it's not clear that this is a worthwhile pursuit in any case--as Jin Ha Lee and An h Thu Nguyen argue in their study of the South Korean band BTS, relationships between pieces of music may be best understood with concepts other than genre.

Text 2

Tango is a genre of music originally from Argentina and Uruguay that shares some harmonic and rhythmic similarities with the pagode genre. Automated genre classification systems typically struggle to draw distinctions in situations like this, but Yandre Costa and colleagues solved that problem by converting sound to images and having computers compare features of those images, an approach that demonstrates how much innovation is possible in this field.
questions.question: Based on the texts, how would the author of Text 2 most likely respond to the claim in the underline sentence of Text 1

options.name: A
options.content: By arguing that people tend to disagree when identifying genre classifications for music

options.name: B
options.content: By suggesting that the concept of genre may become more useful for music listeners

options.name: C
options.content: By criticizing previous research into automated music genre classification for favoring specific genre categories

options.name: D
options.content: By asserting that it may be possible to improve automated classification systems

questions.correct: By asserting that it may be possible to improve automated classification systems
questions.solution:
翻译：
文本 1
将音乐自动分类到不同流派的尝试并不太成功，我们可能已经达到了技术上的极限。但无论如何，这是否是一项值得追求的事情尚不清楚 —— 正如李珍河（Jin Ha Lee）和阮安秋（An h Thu Nguyen）在对韩国乐队防弹少年团（BTS）的研究中所指出的，音乐作品之间的关系或许最好用流派之外的概念来理解。
文本 2
探戈是一种起源于阿根廷和乌拉圭的音乐流派，它与帕戈德（pagode）流派在和声和节奏上有一些相似之处。自动流派分类系统在这种情况下通常难以区分，但扬德雷・科斯塔（Yandre Costa）及其同事通过将声音转换为图像并让计算机比较这些图像的特征解决了这个问题，这种方法展示了该领域的创新潜力。
题目翻译：
7. 根据这两篇文本，文本 2 的作者最可能如何回应文本 1 中划线句子的观点？
解析：
文本 1 划线句观点是音乐自动分类尝试不太成功，可能达技术极限；文本 2 中 Yandre Costa 及其同事通过创新方法解决了自动流派分类系统的难题，展示该领域创新可能性。
  • A 选项：文本 2 未提及人们对音乐流派分类的看法差异，不符合文本 2 作者回应角度。
  • B 选项：文本 2 未讨论流派概念对音乐听众的作用，不符合要求。
  • C 选项：文本 2 未批评之前研究对特定流派的偏好，不符合文本 2 作者意图。
  • D 选项：文本 2 展示了通过创新方法改进自动分类系统的可能性，与该选项 “断言改进自动分类系统是可能的” 相符。
综上，正确答案是 D

questions.article:
The following text is adapted from Adib Khorram's 2018 novel Darius the Great Is Not Okay. Darius, a teenager from the United States, is visiting his family members in Iran.

I dozed and floated on the clouds of Farsi that blew my way from the front seat of Dayi [Uncle] Jamsheed's SUV.

It reminded me of when I was little, and Mom chanted to me in Farsi every night before bedtime. It's hard to describe Farsi chanting: the way Mom drew her voice out like the notes of a cello as she recited poems by Rumi or Hafez. I didn't know what they meant, but that didn't matter. It was quiet and soothing.

©2018 by Adib Khorram
questions.question: Based on the text, what does the narrator mainly remember about the times when his mother chanted to him?

options.name: A
options.content: That he liked the characters in the stories his mother made up while chanting.

options.name: B
options.content: That his mother had music playing in the background while she chanted.

options.name: C
options.content: That his mother didn't usually chant at night.

options.name: D
options.content: That he found the sound of his mother's chanting to be calming.

questions.correct: That he found the sound of his mother's chanting to be calming.
questions.solution:
翻译：
以下文本改编自阿迪布・霍拉姆 2018 年的小说《大流士不太好》。大流士，一名来自美国的少年，正在伊朗看望他的家人。
我昏昏欲睡，沉浸在从贾姆希德叔叔（Dayi Jamsheed）的 SUV 前排座位传来的波斯语声音中。
这让我想起小时候，妈妈每天晚上睡前都会用波斯语给我吟唱。很难形容波斯语吟唱：妈妈在背诵鲁米或哈菲兹的诗时，把声音拖得像大提琴的音符一样。我不懂那些诗的意思，但这并不重要。那声音安静又舒缓。
题目翻译：
8. 根据文本，叙述者主要记得母亲给他吟唱时的什么？
解析：
文中提到 “我不懂那些诗的意思，但这并不重要。那声音安静又舒缓” ，表明叙述者主要记住的是母亲吟唱声带来的平静感受。
  • A 选项：文中未提及母亲吟唱时编的故事及其中的角色，不符合原文。
  • B 选项：文中没有提到母亲吟唱时有背景音乐，不符合原文。
  • C 选项：原文明确说母亲每天晚上睡前吟唱，该选项与原文不符。
  • D 选项：“他觉得母亲的吟唱声令人平静” ，符合文中对母亲吟唱声 “安静又舒缓” 的描述。
综上，正确答案是 D

questions.article: Horses and barn owls can see in three dimensions (3D), which helps them perceive distance and depth. Octopuses and squid are thought to lack 3D vision. Many researchers once thought the same about cuttlefish, but Trevor Wardill and his team wanted to test whether this assumption was true. The team studied how cuttlefish wearing 3D glasses reacted to 3D images of shrimp (a favorite prey) projected on a tank wall. Cuttlefish changed their striking position to match the 3D images, suggesting that their vision is more like that of horses and barn owls than that of octopuses or squid.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Researchers have long known that horses and barn owls can see in 3D.

options.name: B
options.content: Cuttlefish are surprisingly similar in structure to octopuses and squid.

options.name: C
options.content: Contrary to what many researchers had assumed, cuttlefish may be able to see in 3D.

options.name: D
options.content: The ability to see in 3D allows many animals to interact with one another.

questions.correct: Contrary to what many researchers had assumed, cuttlefish may be able to see in 3D.

questions.article:
Minimum and Maximum Depths of Stony Coral
Species in Caribbean and Indo-Pacific Waters

The table is from a 2018 study in which Luiz Rocha and colleagues examined the ranges of depths at which certain stony coral species have been found in Caribbean and Indo-Pacific waters. Among the corals in the table, the species with the greatest range between minimum and maximum depths is ______
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses data from the table to complete the statement?

questions.article: The Underdogs is a 1915 novel by Mariano Azuela, originally written in Spanish. In the novel, a group of soldiers travel through a canyon, where their collective mood becomes strongly affected by the strenuous conditions of their journey: ______
questions.question: Which quotation from a translation of The Underdogs most effectively illustrates the claim?

options.name: A
options.content: "The sierra is clad in gala colors. Over its inaccessible peaks the opalescent fog settles like a snowy veil on the forehead of a bride."

options.name: B
options.content: "All day long [the soldiers] rode through the canyon, up and down the steep, round hills, dirty and bald as a man's head, hill after hill in endless succession."

options.name: C
options.content: "Then, hurriedly, [the soldiers] took the Juchipila canyon northward, without halting to rest until nightfall."

options.name: D
options.content: "The sun, beating down upon [the soldiers], dulled their minds and bodies and presently they were silent."

questions.correct: "The sun, beating down upon [the soldiers], dulled their minds and bodies and presently they were silent."

questions.article:
US Hydroelectric Power Plants, 2019

Plant State Mode Average annual power generation (MWh/yr) Water Source
Scanlon Plant Minnesota Run-of-river 7,511 St. Louis River
Kansas River Plant Kansas Run-of-river 15,345 Kansas River
Squa Pan Hydro Maine Peaking 881 Squa Pan Stream
Great Falls Tennessee Peaking 124,392 Caney Fork River

A run-of-river hydroelectric power plant, as the name suggests, uses the natural flow of a water source to generate electricity but is unable to start or stop that flow through its generators. In contrast, a peaking hydroelectric power plant (used when demand for electricity peaks) controls the flow of water through its generators: starting flow when demand is high enough, stopping it when demand is too low, and otherwise regulating it to keep pace with changing electricity needs. Although peaking plants do not typically operate continuously as run-of-river plants do, peaking plants can generate more megawatt-hours of power per year (MWh/yr) than some run-of-river plants. For example, the ______
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses data from the table to complete the example?

options.name: A
options.content: average power generated annually by the Great Falls plant is higher than that generated by any of the run-of-river plants in the table.

options.name: B
options.content: Scanlon plant, which is a run-of-river plant, has more generators than any of the other plants in the table.

options.name: C
options.content: run-of-river plant with the highest average annual power generation in the table generates more electricity than the peaking plant with the highest annual power generation in the table.

options.name: D
options.content: average power generated annually by the Kansas River plant is higher than that generated by the Scanlon plant.

questions.correct: average power generated annually by the Great Falls plant is higher than that generated by any of the run-of-river plants in the table.
questions.solution:
美国水电站（2019 年）​​​​​​​
电站所在州模式年均发电量（兆瓦时 / 年）水源
斯坎伦电站明尼苏达州径流式7511圣路易斯河
堪萨斯河电站堪萨斯州径流式15345堪萨斯河
斯夸潘水电站缅因州调峰式881斯夸潘溪
大瀑布电站田纳西州调峰式124392卡尼福克河
径流式水电站，顾名思义，利用水源的自然水流发电，但无法通过发电机启动或停止水流。相比之下，调峰式水电站（在用电高峰时使用）控制通过发电机的水流：当需求足够高时启动水流，当需求过低时停止水流，否则进行调节以适应不断变化的用电需求。尽管调峰式电站不像径流式电站那样通常持续运行，但调峰式电站每年产生的兆瓦时电量（MWh/yr）可能比一些径流式电站更多。例如，____
解析：
  • A 选项：大瀑布电站（调峰式）年均发电量 124392 MWh/yr ，高于表格中任何径流式电站的发电量，能有效说明调峰式电站比一些径流式电站发电量多，符合要求。
  • B 选项：表格中未提及各电站发电机数量，无法从表格数据得出此结论，不符合要求。
  • C 选项：表格中径流式电站最高年均发电量（堪萨斯河电站 15345 MWh/yr ）低于调峰式电站最高年均发电量（大瀑布电站 124392 MWh/yr ） ，该选项说法错误，不符合要求。
  • D 选项：堪萨斯河电站和斯坎伦电站都是径流式电站，此选项对比的是径流式电站之间的发电量，没有体现调峰式电站和径流式电站发电量的对比，不符合要求。
综上，正确答案是 A。

questions.article: The 2000 production of The Green Bird was the first Broadway show for which Constance Hoffman was credited as a costume designer. Hoffman was among the Broadway costume designers interviewed by Sara Jablon-Roberts and Eulanda A. Sanders for their study of historical accuracy in costume design for shows with a historical setting. They found that even designers who value historical accuracy will often include contemporary design elements that don't fit with the historical period. In a research paper about theatrical costume design, a student argues that costume designers for modern productions of Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream (set in ancient Greece) sometimes include such elements unintentionally.
questions.question: Which quotation from an interview with a costume designer would most effectively support the student's claim?

options.name: A
options.content: "I tend to pay careful attention to a character's accessories like gloves, hats, and jackets. These elements help communicate information about how this person would have fit into society at the time."

options.name: B
options.content: "I aim to create a clear sense of the character and the world they inhabit. Sometimes this means adhering to the historical period's style, but frequently, as in stagings of A Midsummer Night's Dream, some flexibility is required to communicate an idea to the audience."

options.name: C
options.content: "Costumes must always reflect the correct historical period. Too often, I've seen costumes that borrow from a wide span of periods, resulting in a production with a confusing visual style."

options.name: D
options.content: "In the 1980s I was costuming for a production of A Midsummer Night's Dream. Even though I focused on using the correct materials and techniques for the play's period in history, when I look back I can clearly see the influence of 1980s fashion in my designs."

questions.correct: "In the 1980s I was costuming for a production of A Midsummer Night's Dream. Even though I focused on using the correct materials and techniques for the play's period in history, when I look back I can clearly see the influence of 1980s fashion in my designs."

questions.article: In order to identify research trends, Shirley Ann Williams et al., reviewed a collection of studies of the social media website Twitter, such as the 2011 paper by Celik et al., titled "Learning Semantic Relationships between Entities in Twitter." Williams's team searched for the term "Twitter" on the Scopus and Web of Science databases and found that, though most papers returned by the search did in fact focus on the social media platform, a few discussed unrelated subjects such as sounds made by tractor engines. One reasonable explanation for this result is that it occurred because ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: a group of researchers had an extensive discussion on Twitter about the design of tractor engines.

options.name: B
options.content: most of the papers in the Scopus and Web of Science databases do not discuss automotive engines or social media websites.

options.name: C
options.content: the word "twitter" may not always refer to a social media website, but to other subjects such as noises made by machines.

options.name: D
options.content: academics who are active on social networks are likely to announce their recent publications on Twitter.

questions.correct: the word "twitter" may not always refer to a social media website, but to other subjects such as noises made by machines.
questions.solution:
翻译：
为了确定研究趋势，雪莉・安・威廉姆斯等人回顾了一系列关于社交媒体网站推特（Twitter）的研究，比如切利克等人 2011 年发表的题为《学习推特中实体间的语义关系》的论文。威廉姆斯团队在斯高帕斯（Scopus）和科学网（Web of Science）数据库中搜索 “Twitter” 一词，发现虽然搜索结果中的大多数论文确实聚焦于这个社交媒体平台，但也有一些讨论了不相关的主题，比如拖拉机发动机发出的声音。对于这一结果，一个合理的解释是，它之所以发生是因为____
题目：
14. 以下哪个选项最符合逻辑地完成了文本？
解析：
文本中提到搜索 “Twitter” 时出现了与社交媒体平台无关的内容，需要找一个能解释这种现象的原因。
  • A 选项：一群研究人员在推特上广泛讨论拖拉机发动机设计，不能解释为什么搜索 “Twitter” 会出现不相关主题的论文，不符合逻辑。
  • B 选项：数据库中大多数论文不讨论汽车发动机或社交媒体网站，与搜索 “Twitter” 出现不相关主题的原因无关，不符合逻辑。
  • C 选项：“twitter” 这个词可能并不总是指社交媒体网站，还可能指机器发出的噪音等其他主题，很好地解释了为什么搜索 “Twitter” 会出现不相关主题的论文，符合逻辑。
  • D 选项：活跃在社交网络上的学者可能在推特上宣布他们最近的出版物，与搜索 “Twitter” 出现不相关主题的原因无关，不符合逻辑。
综上，正确答案是 C

questions.article: In a 2012 study in the United States, Michael E. Berndt and Travis K. Bavin found a positive association between levels of dissolved organic carbon and mercury in bodies of fresh water. Many other studies have yielded similar results, suggesting to some scientists that this association is true for all bodies of fresh water. But much of that research has been conducted at broadly similar sites in North America, and when Seam Noh and colleagues examined bodies of fresh water in South Korea, they found a negative association between dissolved organic carbon levels and mercury levels. If similar findings emerge from other locations outside North America, that could suggest that ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: the mercury levels reported in Noh and colleagues' study were much higher than those reported in the study by Berndt and Bavin even though the dissolved organic carbon levels reported in the two studies were approximately the same.

options.name: B
options.content: Berndt and Bavin may have inadvertently measured a different characteristic of bodies of fresh water than their levels of dissolved organic carbon and mercury.

options.name: C
options.content: the relationship between dissolved organic carbon and mercury reported by Berndt and Bavin reflects conditions that are characteristic of certain kinds of ecosystems in North America rather than universal conditions.

options.name: D
options.content: most of the studies conducted in North America have measured dissolved organic carbon and mercury levels at a higher level of precision than was the case in Noh and colleagues' study.

questions.correct: the relationship between dissolved organic carbon and mercury reported by Berndt and Bavin reflects conditions that are characteristic of certain kinds of ecosystems in North America rather than universal conditions.
questions.solution:
翻译：
在 2012 年美国的一项研究中，迈克尔・E・伯恩特（Michael E. Berndt）和特拉维斯・K・巴文（Travis K. Bavin）发现淡水体中溶解有机碳水平与汞含量之间存在正相关关系。许多其他研究也得出了类似结果，这让一些科学家认为这种相关性适用于所有淡水体。但大部分此类研究都是在北美大致相似的地点进行的，当诺姆・诺（Seam Noh）及其同事在韩国检测淡水体时，他们发现溶解有机碳水平与汞含量之间呈负相关。如果在北美以外的其他地区也出现类似发现，那就可能表明____
题目：
15. 以下哪个选项最符合逻辑地完成了文本？
解析：
之前北美很多研究显示淡水体中溶解有机碳和汞含量正相关，而韩国的研究结果不同。若其他北美以外地区也有类似韩国的结果，说明之前北美的研究结果不具有普遍性。
  • A 选项：比较两个研究中汞含量和溶解有机碳含量数值，没有从整体上说明相关性是否具有普遍性，不符合逻辑。
  • B 选项：说伯恩特和巴文可能测错了，与北美以外地区研究结果对整体相关性的影响无关，不符合逻辑。
  • C 选项：表明伯恩特和巴文所报告的溶解有机碳和汞之间的关系反映的是北美某些生态系统的特征，而非普遍情况，符合北美以外地区出现不同结果所暗示的内容，符合逻辑。
  • D 选项：讨论研究精度，与北美以外地区研究结果对溶解有机碳和汞相关性的影响无关，不符合逻辑。
综上，正确答案是 C

questions.article: In the thought-provoking 2010 exhibition Relative Pelican at the Stux Gallery in New York, Sokari Douglas Camp presented sculptures that had been ______ welded from recycled metal materials, such as oil drums. In doing so, the London-based Nigerian sculptor challenged viewers to imagine new uses and futures for the material wastes of the past.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.article: In Puerto Rico, it's not unusual for a city or town to be known ______ a nickname that corresponds to one of its notable features, like landscape, climate, famous residents, or chief exports. For example, the Puerto Rican municipality of Hatillo has also been called "the Land of Green Fields," a nickname that alludes to what the area is well known for: the lush greenery that surrounds it.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.article: In 2021, Sarah McAnulty ______ as a biologist at the University of Connecticut, studying squids.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution: 句子里需要有谓语动词，因此B是正确选项。其他三个选项都是非谓语动词，不能选。

questions.article: The word "robot" ______ first used in the 1920 play R. U. R. by Czech author Karel Capek.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.article: In the spring of 1964, it was hard to go anywhere without hearing the song "Cotton Candy" by the Sylvers. As of April 11, the song had spent thirteen straight weeks on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and ______ No. 1 on the list.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.article: In 2000, the United States Congress designated a portion of Pennsylvania as the Lackawanna Valley National Heritage Area, ______ the region's unique natural, cultural, and historical attributes.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution:
翻译：
2000 年，美国国会将宾夕法尼亚州的一部分划定为拉克瓦纳谷国家遗产区，____该地区独特的自然、文化和历史属性。
题目：
21. 以下哪个选项能使文本符合标准英语的规范？
解析：
这里需要一个非谓语动词形式来作伴随状语，说明美国国会划定遗产区这个动作的同时所做的事。
  • A 选项：“they cite” 是主谓结构，不能直接放在此处，不符合语法规范。
  • B 选项：“cited” 是过去分词，通常表被动或完成，这里 “cite（列举；提及）” 与主语 “Congress” 是主动关系，所以该选项不符合。
  • C 选项：“citing” 是现在分词，可作伴随状语，与主语 “Congress” 是主动关系，符合语法规范，意思是 “列举；提及” ，表示国会在划定遗产区时提及该地区独特属性。
  • D 选项：“has cited” 是谓语动词形式，一个句子中不能有两个谓语（前面已有 “designated” ），不符合语法规范。
综上，正确答案是 C

questions.article: In 1940, scientists first isolated a sample of the steroid hormone androstenone, which they knew existed in animals—and, they assumed, only in animals. ______ scientists know that androstenone can also be found in chokecherry plants (Prunus virginiana), but this discovery didn't occur until decades later.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.article: According to traditional classifications, each of William Shakespeare's plays belongs to one of three distinct genres: comedy, history, or tragedy. The play Much Ado About Nothing (1598-99), ______ is classified as a comedy, whereas Richard II (1595) is classified as a history.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.article: If you were to view the Ol Kokwe volcano in Kenya or the Asavyo volcano in Ethiopia from above, you might notice that their low profiles and gently sloping sides make each of them look a bit like a shield lying flat on the ground. ______ volcanologists classify volcanoes of this type as shield volcanoes.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.article: Though its onboard laboratory allowed it to analyze rock samples on site, the 2011 Mars Curiosity rover was unable to preserve samples for future analysis. ______ when creating the 2020 Mars Perseverance rover, robotics mechanical engineer Arash Kalantari and other members of NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory sought to implement a mechanism that could do exactly that.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.article: Though the musical groups Los Palominos and Banda Los Recoditos are often categorized under the catchall "regional Mexican music" label, they each adhere to distinct musical traditions. The former works within the tejano tradition, which originated in mid-twentieth-century Texas and northern Mexico. The latter, ______ follows the banda tradition, with roots in mid-nineteenth-century southern and central Mexico.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.article: Water from the aquifers of Alaska's Susitna Glacier travels the 160 km length of the Skwentna River before flowing into the Yentna River and then reaching the mouth of the river system's main stem, the Susitna River. ______ at the Susitna's mouth, hundreds of kilometers from the source, the water empties into the Gulf of Alaska.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?
